devdoc.details: Collection of common custom errors used in multiple contracts IMPORTANT: Backwards compatibility is not guaranteed in future versions of the library. It is recommended to avoid relying on the error API for critical functionality.

FailedCall().details: A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.

InsufficientBalance(uint256,uint256).details: The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation.

bytecode.opcodes: PUSH1 0x80 DUP1 PUSH1 0x40 MSTORE CALLVALUE PUSH1 0x17 JUMPI PUSH1 0x39 SWAP1 DUP2 PUSH1 0x1C DUP3 CODECOPY ADDRESS DUP2 POP POP RETURN JUMPDEST PUSH0 DUP1 REVERT INVALID PUSH0 DUP1 REVERT INVALID LOG2 PUSH5 0x6970667358 0x22 SLT KECCAK256 EXP SWAP1 0xF8 0xC8 CALL POP SWAP10 PUSH7 0x95E139EA9852E6 SWAP5 SHL OR PUSH18 0x4B90F1E86EB936CBD2464DED8264736F6C63 NUMBER STOP ADDMOD OR STOP CALLER

deployedBytecode.opcodes: PUSH0 DUP1 REVERT INVALID LOG2 PUSH5 0x6970667358 0x22 SLT KECCAK256 EXP SWAP1 0xF8 0xC8 CALL POP SWAP10 PUSH7 0x95E139EA9852E6 SWAP5 SHL OR PUSH18 0x4B90F1E86EB936CBD2464DED8264736F6C63 NUMBER STOP ADDMOD OR STOP CALLER

devdoc.details: Helper to make usage of the `CREATE2` EVM opcode easier and safer. `CREATE2` can be used to compute in advance the address where a smart contract will be deployed, which allows for interesting new mechanisms known as 'counterfactual interactions'. See the https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1014#motivation[EIP] for more information.
